question:
2019 marked 70 years since the founding of NATO. In this context, consider the following statements about its founding treaty:
  1. Article 5 of the treaty has never been invoked.
  2. The treaty is also known as the Washington Treaty.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty is the most significant component of the legal document. It provides that a military attack on one of the NATO members counts as an attack against them all. It was invoked only once and that was by the USA. This was after the 9/11 terrorist attack. Statement 2 is correct: The North Atlantic Treaty is also known as the Washington Treaty. It was signed in Washington, D.C. on April 4th, 1949. The treaty forms the legal basis for the foundation of NATO which is the largest military alliance in the world. Its current membership stands at 29 countries.
